description:
The Industry Software Project Letter Agreement document for our subject (SWEN90013 - 2021) is here. 

Every student is required to sign an IP agreement signing over the IP to the University. The agreement is the standard one developed in conjunction with  the University legal team. Please be in touch with the Subject Coordinator if you have any questions. If the client is an external entity,  the University then signs an appropriate agreement effectively giving the IP to the company, as they are really the only entity who can maintain the IP going forward. The easiest way is for you to submit the signed agreement electronically. This is an unmarked assignment that you need to complete by March 21.

What do you need to do?

1. Download the document here

2. Open the PDF file in Adobe Acrobat Reader

3. On Page 1, click on Fill & Sign in the Tools pane on the right

    • Add the date you signed the document: day, month and year
    • Provide your full name, address and telephone to the document

(page 1)

4. On Page 3, click on Fill & Sign in the Tools pane on the right

    • Add your full name between the ( parenthesis )
    • Add the full name of your Witness (another team member or your supervisor)

(page 3)

5. Click Sign, and then select Add Signature

    • Sign the document under your name

6. A popup will open, giving you three options—Type, Draw, and Image. Once you’re done, click the Apply button.

7. Drag, resize and position the signature inside your PDF file.

8. Ask your witness to sign your document

DEADLINE: 21 March 2022

Industry Software Project Letter Agreement document

StudentDEED.pdf
name: Letter Agreement

description:
Hi everyone,

Welcome to our very first peer assessment review in the subject.

This is an individual mandatory task. Everyone needs to participate, assess and provide feedback to peers. Please spend some time in this activity. It's very important each and all of you provide insightful feedback to your team members. Regardless of having a great or bad team experience, you are encouraged to provide feedback. The survey shouldn't take you longer than 10 minutes to be completed.

It is essential that everyone can contribute equally to group work. The peer assessment form will give us (teaching team) an indication when this is not the case.

Peer review grading breakdown is shown below:

   

 

I hope the following guideline can help you with your assessment:

(i) Before you even make your first comment, read the survey all the way through;

(ii) If something is unclear, do not ignore the item but ask the lecturer for clarification;

(iii) Point out the strengths as well as the weaknesses of the team member you're assessing;

(iv) Comments should be appropriate, respectful and constructive. There is no need to be rude. Be respectful and considerate of the other's feelings. (Would you like to receive the comments/feedback you wrote? Are they clear, helpful and respectful? Are they helping the other person to reflect and understand what happened or is currently happening in the project?);

(v) Be sure that your comments are clear and specific so that your peer will know what you are referring to. Provide examples if possible;

(vi) Follow the feedback form and the issues you are supposed to address;

(vii) Reread your comments before submitting your contributions. Make sure all your comments make sense and are easy to follow.
name: Peer Feedback Semester 1

name: Peer Feedback Semester 2

description:
You are required to submit the attached checklist. You will be assessed on both process and progress with artefacts.

Before submitting you should check whether the documentation is up to date, whether using Confluence or some other Wiki; Trello, JIRA, or your other task management is up to date; your QA process; records of meetings; retrospectives; planning, etc.

You should also give a brief overview of progress on Requirements, Design, Coding, Testing, Deployment.

Checklist: SWEN90013 Progress Checklist.docx 

Rubric: Progress Rubric for SWEN90013.xlsx
name: First Process Assessment

description:
Upload the presentation slides for your Semester 1 Presentation.

Presentation Requirements

  • Team details
  • Description
  • Motivational model (or other requirements overview)
  • Tasks completed
  • Key challenges
  • Key accomplishments
  • Live Demo

Assessment will be based on  Content (50%), Structure and organisation (30%), Entertainment value (20%)

name: Product submission

description:
Submit a link to your team video, or confirm that the video has been transferred to the Subject Coordinator.

The video needs to be between 2 and 5 minutes and should give a project summary.

You will be able to use this video for Endeavour. There is no requirement for you to produce a 'Road to Endeavour video.'
name: Team video

description:
The professional communication report has 3 components.

Component 1: Personal objectives (worth 5 points)

 

Component 2: Guest lecture report (worth 5 points)

Component 3 Ethics report (worth 10 points)

There will be five points awarded for the quality of writing. The 25 point total will then be scaled back to a mark out of five.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Specification for Personal objectives

List three objectives you hope to achieve by the end of the year, along with measures of how you will achieve them. Note you will need to reflect on these objectives in Professional Communication Report 2.

Objectives (Example from 2017)

  • 1. Follow processes more rigorously
  • 2. Collaborate better with teammates
  • 3. Ensure code is well-tested
  • 4. Learn a new language or framework

Measurement Criteria

  • 1. <10% of my work does not follow established (agreed upon) processes
  •  2. Merge all code with reviews. Pair program on a feature. Give constructive feedback to 3 pull requests
  • 3. Achieve at least 80% statement coverage for code tests 
  • 4. Know a programming language or development framework that I previously was unfamiliar with 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Specification for Guest lecture report

Write a 250-400 words reflective report on what you found interesting on one of the guest lectures delivered in Semester 1. The report should not be a summary of the lecture. You need to include a piece of feedback for the lecturer of up to 50 words. (If there were two guest lecturers in the session, you need to provide feedback for each of them.)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Specification for ethics report:

The ethics report can be completed in one of three ways.

1. Play the ethics simulation developed by SWEN90013 students in 2020. Details of the game are at https://game-of-ethics.herokuapp.com/. 

In order to explore Game of Ethics, you need to create a new game and share the game ID with other 4 participants. The game can only be played as multi-player (5 students simultaneously). For more instructions, please access 'Help'. Write 500-800 words describing what you learned from playing the game, whether it was an effective tool for teaching ethics, and any suggestions for improvement.

2. Write 500-800 words about the relevance of the ACS Code of Ethics for your team SWEN90013 project. I

3. Find an article about an ethical issue in IT and write 500-800 words summarising the issue and why you found it interesting.
name: Professional Communication Report 1

description:
The report should consist of three sections.

Section 1: Yearlong reflection report (4 points)

The reflection should include

  • A discussion of your personal objectives submitted in Semester 1, whether they have been achieved, and whether in retrospect you preferred they would have been different
  • (At least) Two things you learned from the yearlong project
  • (At least) One thing you could have improved upon during the project
  • Whether the subject met your expectations
  • Anything else you want to mention

Section 2: Guest lecture report (1 point)

Write a response to the zoom lecture delivered by <guest lecturer> on <date of lecture>. Your response should contain the following:

- An item of feedback to <guest lecturer> about his/her lecture.

- A discussion of the value of the lecture to the subject coordinator, and an opinion as to whether to maintain the guest lecturer in the future.

Note that a summary of the lecture is not required. Also note that the word count is indicative, and there is no penalty for exceeding the word length.

If there are multiple guest lecturers, an item of feedback needs to be given to each of the lecturers.

Section 3: COMP30022 engagement report   (4 points)

If you are a COMP30022 client, the report must describe your meetings with the team.

  • 200+ words about the meetings you had with the team
  • 200+ words about product handover and a discussion of outcomes, both process and product
  • 100+ words about your experience as a client, and any suggestions for improvement

If you are a COMP30022 supervisor, the report must describe reflections on your supervisor experience, and a discussion of the effectiveness of using SWEN90013 students as clients.

There is 1 point for general quality of writing and degree of interest.
name: Professional Communication Report 2

description:
The individual contribution statement is an opportunity for you to explain your individual accomplishments in 1-3 pages during the yearlong project. The statement is directly assessed, but will be be helpful for your supervisor in assigning a mark for your individual contribution. It is a chance to highlight things you have done that may not be visible from the documents in your various repositories or performance in meetings. 

A suggested rubric for supervisors to use to help guide their assessment of individual contribution is as follows:

IndividualRubric.xlsx

Need to include a response to peer feedback.
name: Individual contribution statement
